subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Acronyms and Abbreviations
msgSnippet: ... This issue has probably come because of the news in QS, and I meant to start a thread on it, suggesting exactly what you have. As it stands now, words like
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Ron Cameron scripsit:
>
> > Any thoughts some sort of standard?
>
> In the case of internationally understood acronyms, I think we should
> do what Japanese and Chinese do, and use the Latin script
> for them.
>

This issue has probably come because of the news in QS, and I meant to
start a thread on it, suggesting exactly what you have. As it stands
now, words like US (United States) appears as "jM es" or "Ye-Ooze Et
See." That is pretty awkward.

Paul
